metadata.title: CVE-2022-21489 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Cluster product of Oracle MySQL (component:Cluster: General). Supported versions that are affected are 7.4.35 andprior, 7.5.25 and prior, 7.6.21 and prior and 8.0.28 and prior. Difficultto exploit vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with access to thephysical communication segment attached to the hardware where the MySQLCluster executes to compromise MySQL Cluster. Successful attacks requirehuman interaction from a person other than the attacker. Successful attacksof this vulnerability can result in takeover of MySQL Cluster. CVSS 3.1Base Score 6.3 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSSVector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:A/AC:H/PR:H/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
cluster: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
